facts: Cows have best friends and get stressed when separated from them.
Octopuses have three hearts nine brains and blue blood.
The thumbs up gesture is offensive in some Middle Eastern countries.
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3000 years old and still perfectly good to eat.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896. It lasted only 38 minutes.
Sea otters hold hands while sleeping so they don't drift apart.
The inventor of the frisbee was turned into a frisbee after death. Walter Morrison was cremated and his ashes were molded into frisbees.
Bananas are berries but strawberries aren't.
Roosters have built-in earplugs to prevent themselves from going deaf from their own crowing.
A 'jiffy' is an actual unit of time: 1/100th of a second.
The average person walks the equivalent of three times around the world in their lifetime.
The Hawaiian alphabet only has 12 letters.
Koalas have fingerprints so similar to humans that they've been confused at crime scenes.

The scientific name for a panda bear is "Ailuropoda melanoleuca" which means "black and white cat-foot".
The longest time between two twins being born is 87 days.
A squid's brain is shaped like a donut and if it eats something too large it can suffer brain damage.
The name of the male seahorse is called a "stalion."
A group of ferrets is called a "business."
The PlayStation was originally intended to be a Nintendo console until a failed partnership.
Mario's original name was 'Jumpman' in the game Donkey Kong.
The Konami Code (Up Up Down Down Left Right Left Right B A) originated from the game Gradius when a developer needed help testing.
The ghosts in Pac-Man each have their own unique AI and personality.
The Nintendo Game Boy survived a bombing during the Gulf War and still works.
Minecraft's Creeper was created by accident when the developer was trying to make a pig model.
In the original Japanese version of Pokémon Team Rocket member James has inflatable breasts in one banned episode.
The maximum level in World of Warcraft used to be 60 but has been increased multiple times over the years.
The first version of Tetris was created on an Elektronika 60 computer which had no graphical display so the blocks were made of text characters.
GoldenEye 007 for N64 was developed by a team of mostly inexperienced developers who had never made a game before.
The name 'Sonic the Hedgehog' came about because the creator wanted a character who could roll into a ball like a hedgehog and move at 'sonic' speed.
Doom was installed on more computers than Windows 95 when they were both released.
In the original design of The Legend of Zelda the Triforce pieces were going to be microchips because the game was going to be set in the future.
The PlayStation 2 was so popular in Japan that it caused a nationwide shortage of chopsticks as the same materials were used for both.
Mario's surname is also 'Mario' making his full name 'Mario Mario'.
The Xbox was originally going to be called the DirectX Box.
The game Skyrim contains over 60000 lines of dialogue.
Mortal Kombat's character Scorpion's catchphrase 'Get over here!' was improvised during development.
Super Mario Bros. was developed by only six people.
The Wii Remote was codenamed 'Revolution' during development.
The first game to feature an Easter egg was Adventure for the Atari 2600 released in 1979.
The Nintendo 64 controller was designed with three prongs but humans only have two hands.
In Grand Theft Auto V there are more lines of dialogue than in the entire Lord of the Rings trilogy.
The original Street Fighter had only two playable characters and pressure-sensitive buttons that determined the strength of attacks.
The name 'SEGA' is derived from 'SErvice GAmes' which was its original business model as a slot machine company.

The PlayStation 1 logo was designed to represent the letters 'P' and 'S' in 3D.
The Xbox 360's "Red Ring of Death" failure cost Microsoft over $1 billion in repairs and warranty extensions.
In the original Super Mario Bros. the clouds and bushes are the same sprite just colored differently.
The Final Fantasy series was named "Final" because its creator Square was facing bankruptcy and believed it would be his last game.
Pac-Man was inspired by a pizza with a slice missing.
The "Fatality" moves in Mortal Kombat were added at the last minute.
Nintendo was founded in 1889 as a playing card company.
The popular game Tetris has been scientifically proven to help people with PTSD.
The cheat code "xyzzy" originated from the 1977 text adventure game "Colossal Cave Adventure."
The original Xbox controller was nicknamed "The Duke" because of its large size.
E.T. for Atari 2600 was developed in just five weeks and is considered one of the worst games ever made.
The highest-grossing arcade game of all time is Pac-Man.
The first video game easter egg was placed in the game Adventure for the Atari 2600 in 1979.
Atari had to bury millions of unsold E.T. game cartridges in a New Mexico landfill.
In Pokémon Red and Blue the Pokémon Ditto was originally planned to be an imperfect clone of Mew.
The character Q*bert's swearing is represented by symbols like "%!@*!"
The popular RPG series "Final Fantasy" was supposed to be Square's last game before they went bankrupt.
The sound of Mario's jump was inspired by the sound of a person entering a swimming pool.
World of Warcraft's source code was once over 5.5 million lines of code.
Sonic the Hedgehog's shoes were inspired by Michael Jackson's boots and Santa Claus's red color.
Assassin's Creed was originally developed as a sequel to Prince of Persia.
The first Easter egg in a video game was in Adventure for the Atari 2600 created by Warren Robinett who hid his name in a secret room.
The PlayStation was originally a CD add-on for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System.
The first game to feature a 'pause' button was Asteroids in 1979.
Pong wasn't the first video game; Tennis for Two was created in 1958.
The maximum score possible in Pac-Man is 3333360 points.
Nintendo was founded in 1889 as a playing card company before becoming a video game company.
The Witcher 3 contains over 36 different possible endings.
The term "boss fight" originated from early arcade games where players would battle the game's "boss" or owner.
The development of Guitar Hero was influenced by a Japanese arcade game called Guitar Freaks.
World of Warcraft players have spent over 6 million years of combined gameplay time.
The Mario character was named after Nintendo of America's landlord Mario Segale.
The famous "Konami Code" (up up down down left right left right B A) was created as a debug code for the game Gradius.
In the beta version of Portal 2 Wheatley was originally supposed to be called Pendleton.
The first company with a specialized CPU for 3D graphics processing was SEGA.
The Gran Turismo series has sold over 80 million copies worldwide.
The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time was developed concurrently with Super Mario 64.
Over 1000 people worked on the development of GTA V.
In the original NBA Jam developers added code to make the Chicago Bulls perform worse against the Detroit Pistons.
The Sims was inspired by a house fire that destroyed all of developer Will Wright's possessions.
The first video game to feature voice acting was Radar Scope in 1980.
The developers of Doom 2016 created a fully functional version of the original Doom that can be played within the game.
Super Mario 64 took approximately two years to develop.
The PlayStation 4's controller contains 571 individual parts.
Pokémon was created by Satoshi Tajiri who was inspired by his childhood hobby of collecting insects.
The character Kirby was named after a Nintendo lawyer named John Kirby.
Donkey Kong was originally going to feature Popeye characters but Nintendo couldn't get the license.
The first video game tournament was held at Stanford University for the game Spacewar in 1972.
Halo: Combat Evolved was originally a real-time strategy game designed for Mac before being acquired by Microsoft.
The main character in Half-Life Gordon Freeman was designed to be an "everyman" that players could identify with.
The Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) was first released in 1983 in Japan under the name "Famicom."
The first video game character to have a balloon in the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade was Sonic the Hedgehog in 1993.
Pokémon Red and Blue were originally supposed to contain 190 Pokémon but the developers cut it down to 151.
The game Deus Ex predicted the collapse of the Twin Towers in the year 2000 before it happened in 2001.
The first video game created just for making money was Computer Space in 1971.
The best-selling video game of all time is Minecraft having sold over 238 million copies.
The PlayStation 3 was originally going to have two HDMI ports.
In the beta version of Minecraft zombies dropped feathers when killed.
Kingdom Hearts was created from a chance meeting between a Square Enix producer and a Disney executive in an elevator.
The first commercially successful video game was Pong released in 1972.
The first video game console to have an online network was the Sega Dreamcast.
The first video game was created in 1958 called "Tennis for Two."
The term "Easter Egg" in video games comes from the 1979 game Adventure for the Atari 2600.
The first video game character to be featured on a U.S. postage stamp was Pac-Man in 2016.
The World of Warcraft plague incident of 2005 was later studied by epidemiologists to understand how real diseases spread.
The name "Metroid" is a combination of "metro" and "android."
The creator of Mario Shigeru Miyamoto originally wanted to be a professional manga artist.
The Super Mario Bros. theme song has lyrics in Japan.
The first video game console to use CDs was the TurboGrafx-CD in 1988.
The development of DOOM took 10 months with a team of just 12 people.
The first video game to use a light gun was Seeburg Ray-O-Lite in 1936.

The game Pong was created as a training exercise for a new employee at Atari.

The video game industry is larger than the film and music industries combined.
The term "sandbox game" originated from the comparison to a child's sandbox with few rules and open-ended play.
The first video game console to have a hard drive was the Xbox in 2001.
The development of Fallout 4 began immediately after Fallout 3 was released in 2008.

The Wii was almost called the "Nintendo Revolution."
The original Xbox was named after DirectX Microsoft's graphics API.
The concept of "lives" in video games originated from pinball machines.
The "Thwomps" in Super Mario Bros. were inspired by a Japanese ghost called a Nurikabe.

The game Doom runs on more devices than any other game in history including ATMs calculators and digital cameras.
The game "Spacewar!" created in 1962 is considered the first influential video game.
The original design for Sonic the Hedgehog had him with fangs and a girlfriend named Madonna.

The first video game to feature a day-night cycle was Animal Crossing in 2001.
The first video game music to be performed by a live orchestra was for The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time.

The Japanese version of Kirby is more aggressive in box art than the American version.

The longest development cycle for a video game was Duke Nukem Forever which took 15 years.

The voice actor for Mario Charles Martinet almost didn't go to the audition where he was cast.
The first video game to feature motion capture was Prince of Persia in 1989.
The first video game to feature a dialogue tree was Cosmic Osmo in 1989.

The first video game to feature 3D polygonal graphics was I Robot released in 1983.
The Sega Genesis was more powerful than the Super Nintendo in terms of processing speed.
The word "Nintendo" roughly translates to "leave luck to heaven" in Japanese.
The first video game to feature a mini-map was Rally-X in 1980.
The name "Kirby" was chosen because Nintendo's lawyers admired John Kirby who helped them win a lawsuit against Universal Studios.

The original design of Master Chief in Halo was vastly different with a more slender build and a sleeker helmet.
